review: You are right, but Genshin Impact is a new open world adventure game independently developed by mihoyo. The game takes place in a fantasy world called 'Tivat', where the chosen person is granted the 'Eye of God' to guide the power of the elements. You will play a mysterious character named "Traveler", and encounter companions with different personalities and unique abilities on a free journey. Together, you will defeat strong enemies and retrieve lost loved ones.
be the reason someone closes overwatch

im not gonna write an essay, yall know why this game is shit. not the devs. not the players (although they are questionable at times). the higherups at Activision/Blizzard *ahem* Kotick are the ones to blame for this ruined potential and now cashgrab game. enjoy the game, just do not spend any money on it.
Donwloaded this and played one round so I can leave a negative review. Good job Bobby K and Blizzard. What's next? Release Overwatch 2 Remastered next year?

i played it, and really enjoyed it whilst i was, but thats because this shit is unbalanced as hell and even on my pretty good pc its still performs terribly. not worth your time, and yes, i know im a tf2 player, but i genuinley gave this game a chance and its just not fun at all after the first 30 minutes. dont bother and just play a good game.

Review bombed for no reason. Classic braindead steam community.

The developers of this game, Blizzard, hate players and love money.

They put the live game (Overwatch 1) on the backburner for years under the excuse that it was for Overwatch 2 and the replayable PVE mode.
All we got with Overwatch "2" was underwhelming skins for 20 dollars a piece instead of the fair(!) lootboxes and free skins from events, and the slap in the face that they stopped developing the PVE mode alltogether, probably because it wouldn't be as profitable as just pumping out skins.

Shame on you Blizzard, shame on you.

Installed to see what's going on with current season and Steam integration.  Prior achievement synced with Steam.  Played a QP role queue and a Comp open queue match.  Uninstalled.
I've already played OW for years.  OW2 fails to be any sort of sequel and a reinvention of OW1 to be more profitable via in-game shop and battle passes.  Whereas you could collect skins as a reward for playing the game (earned loot boxes) in OW1, OW2 primarily relies on the shop.  If OW1 still existed as a separate game, for all its downfalls I'm sure it would be favored over OW2.
It's universally agreed the matchmaking is in its worst state ever.
When you make a huge mistake and you have a big name, That mistake gonna be your name
